intro: Aciotis dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched aciotis, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments.
